    • Method Detail

      • testEncoding

        public void testEncoding()
        Test basic encoding functionality. Create encodings without crashing and check they contain the correct number of on and off bits. Check some encodings for expected overlap. Test that encodings for old values don't change once we generate new buckets.

      • testMissingValues

        public void testMissingValues()
        Test that missing values and NaN return all zero's.

      • testResolution

        public void testResolution()
        Test that numbers within the same resolution return the same encoding. Numbers outside the resolution should return different encodings.

      • testMapBucketIndexToNonZeroBits

        public void testMapBucketIndexToNonZeroBits()
        Test that mapBucketIndexToNonZeroBits works and that max buckets and clipping are handled properly.

      • testParameterCheckWithInvalidN

        public void testParameterCheckWithInvalidN()

      • testParameterCheckWithInvalidW

        public void testParameterCheckWithInvalidW()

      • testParameterCheckWithInvalidResolution

        public void testParameterCheckWithInvalidResolution()

      • testOverlapStatistics

        public void testOverlapStatistics()
        Check that the overlaps for the encodings are within the expected range. Here we ask the encoder to create a bunch of representations under somewhat stressfull conditions, and then verify they are correct. We rely on the fact that the _overlapOK and _countOverlapIndices methods are working correctly.

      • testGetMethods

        public void testGetMethods()
        Test that the getWidth, getDescription, and getDecoderOutputFieldTypes methods work.

      • testOffset

        public void testOffset()
        Test that offset is working properly

      • testSeed

        public void testSeed()

      • testCountOverlapIndices
